title: Brand should have its base damage nerfed and its scalings buffed
body:
I think there are more problematic champions than Brand currently, and he isn't the first champion that I would think if someone asked "what champion would you nerf in this patch?" (I am speaking of the amount of Brand threads that have been posted recently)

With that said, I think Brand's main problem is that his base damage is too high, yet he doesn't scale nearly as well with AP. This means he can be very useful as a support, because supports tend to have lower gold income, which will not be a problem for a champion that has high base damages. It also means that he isn't that amazing as the team's main AP carry, because he doesn't scale as well as he should.

It also means that, even when behind and/or having few AP items, he can destroy you.

What should Riot do to fix Brand's problem? The solution is obvious; shift some power from his bases to his scalings. His passive was buffed to 4% of the enemy's maximum health to compensate for DFT being gone, when what Riot should have done is to increase the AP scaling from the explosion when you manage to hit three stacks with Brand's abilities. This would reward him more for comboing the enemy, not just for throwing a spell.

Also. 35% AP scaling on E? 25% AP scaling on the ult? No wonder why Brand is rarely played mid, he isn't rewarded enough for building AP and having a higher gold income.

Reducing Brand's base damage would nerf him as a support, since he would be less useful when behind, which isn't what you want on a support (a support should be useful even when behind, in contrast to a carry, which should scale well, but you can shut down and prevent him from scaling to begin with). 

**TL;DR:** Brand feels OP currently because he has insane base damage, which allows him to heavily damage you even when you are behind. This also makes him very strong as a support. Brand was intended to go mid, but he isn't rewarded enough for building AP to allow him to be more than a niche pick in mid.

Thank you for replying. Funny, but I have been a dedicated midlane Brand on other different server account too since I've joined league during season 3

What I can tell you what DOESN'T feel good about him when I play mid and NEVER felt good, before his rework and even after his rework: it's his **WAVECLEAR**. 

First of all, 3/4 of his abilities are not meant to waveclear. Yes, 3/4 because the only good spell Brand has to clear waves is his W. Conflagration doesn't do enough damage to minions unless maxed and it wastes a good portion of mana, basically wasting it. Q is not meant to waveclear at all, obviously, it's like a "kill a minion for sure" spell if you lack 1-2 AA's to lasthit it.

In fact, his best way to farm a wave is to enhance-W the entirety of it, but you have to aggro minions on yourself for that to happen, since W radius can only hit 3 minions at best, and a wave rarely stacks up for W's radius to be enough to hit all of it. Example: cannon wave, Q cannon, E it + W entire wave while you are surrounded by minions. Obviously noone is going to do that with an enemy laner present,it's asking to get blowned up.

Since waves rarely stack up to hit them with W alone, you have to either waste half your mana pool + a few AA's to clear it in one rotation, or hit melees + casters separately with 2 W's which wastes time and again, more mana, than compared to other midlane mages. If you look at the mage roster, the only others who can't clear waves better than Brand is Fiddlesticks and early on somewhat Zilean. Other example: Kennen has to use all his abilities + several AA's to clear wave in one rotation, and even then he uses energy meanwhile I have to use mana. _Every single other mage_ has better tools to clear waves and for _way less mana_ , and whenever i play Brand it feels that I am at a heavy mana/waveclear disadvantage. 

As midlane Brand, you can be quite oppressive during early stages of the game with good harass and bully your mage opponents well, but the thing is, when playing Brand mid, unless your opponent has a similar waveclear speed with you, you **MUST** play aggressive. If you preserve to a passive playstyle with Brand on mid and decide to simply waveclear with your spells, you eventually will get outpushed every time by mages who can do it better and for less mana,which again, basically everyone. And if you are in a bad matchup, you are forced to play passive in fear of dying to enemy laner (example:Zed) which spells game over. Zoning and bullying helps to mitigate this disadvantage, since you now can use only AA's and seldom spells to clear waves and in turn slow down enemy waveclear by a decent margin because they are afraid of trying to come close to a wave in fear of getting heavily harassed.

I think major part of this problem lies in Brand's overall kit. It feels amazing for fighting, but just feels poor and insufficient for wave management. In my honest opinion, if somehow Brand's E and/or Q could be changed to improve the issue, putting him on the same level with other midlane mages in terms of waveclear, that'd make him overall feel much,much better midlane.
Being forced to clear waves with nearly all your kit also leaves you open for Zed and various other assassins' harass / all-in. And since Brand's cooldowns aren't all too low early on... Y'know.

> [{quoted}](name=Maple Nectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XYf1I911,comment-id=000f00060000,timestamp=2018-07-22T06:29:47.319+0000)
>
> What doesn't feel good for you when playing him mid? I'm interested since I play him mid almost exclusively in ranked.

In my personal opinion as a Diamond V-III Brand main, playing mid as Brand is generally under-performing because of both his waveclear and his ability to take on other mid laners in a 1v1. In team fights he is a monster, but playing him mid you have to sacrafice some lane control vs most match ups and you can't stand toe to toe with other mid laners, namely AP and AD assassins. Due to his low mobility, assassins can win vs Brand quite easily, and it's difficult to consistently land a full Brand combo on agile enemies. Not only that, but most other mid laners can offer a lot more pressure in the early stages of the game to other lanes due to their mobility and ability to target out the heavy hitter (such as getting to bot lane in twice the speed and taking out the adc while you're left either scrounging for some cs or trying to chase after with futility). 

So now that Brand is already behind in the early stages, you'd think he would excel late game. He can, especially if the enemy is grouped and build a lot of HP, but Brand's AP scaling is very poor compared to other mages and he offers little to no CC which is vital for the late game (i.e. Viegar has the best stun in the game and best ap scaling in the game, so naturally he is poor early game but strong late game). That, and Brand can be caught out more easily than even most adc's because of his severe lack of mobility in a meta where mobility is reigning king. Brand is strong, but it still feels lack luster compared to other mid titans. Playing him as a support means that you're not the main focus and you still have a powerful AD/ AP assassin or strong mid laner to help carry you through the game. Also, since Brand is immobile, it would be a good idea to pick up TP on him, except for the fact that after landing a full combo and some other spells will still leave the enemy able to escape (compounded HEAVILY if they take nullifying orb or buy a hexdrinker), so most Brand's will opt to take ignite to have more lane pressure (otherwise it's almost a guaranteed loss unless you're primary focus is farm AND the rest of your team doesn't need your help). 

There really is so easy solution to fixing Brand mid and he seems to be tricky to balance. Some general ideas would be to give him mobility, or more kill pressure in 1v1's while not making it overwhelming, or even the idea of TP scrolls like DoTa 2 has to make it so that immobile champs can have more pressure to outside lanes. Perhaps making his E do more damage for a balanced wave clear or even extending the range of his E so that he offer more kill pressure to those pesky assassins. But of course, doing the latter would make him that much more stronger as a support. After all is said and done, I don't think his passive is the problem. Making the passive scale with AP or even magic pen would be a cool idea, as it would make his late game stronger, but early game he would suffer that much more. Maybe making the passive do more damage depending on how much AD or AP the enemy has will make it a better ability in this damage heavy meta, but that would take away his lure in doing heavy damage to the tanks. 

My best suggestion: 
Perhaps making it so that each of his 3 abilities does a _different type_ of passive scaling damage could be the answer. 
Example: 
- His E would do passive damage that scales with the enemy's max HP like it already does (Basically unchanged). 
- His W would do more passive damage scaling with the enemy's AD. 
- His Q would do more passive damage scaling with the enemy's AP. 
- His R would do more passive damage with their highest adaptive stat. 
- Landing a full combo would double these effects, won't apply all 3 scalings at once, but rather the one that is more applicable, such as tanks receiving the max HP passive damage and AD's receiving the passive AD scaling. . . 

* **Lastly, this passive damage would also scale off of Brand's AP.** That means that if Brand wants to build pure magic pen to punish botlane squishys, he wouldn't do as much passive damage thus hindering his late game. In addition, his early game pressure as a support with his passive ability would go down, but he would also deal more damage to enemies who are doing exceedingly well since he could dish out more passive damage depending on how strong they get. This could also be a counter to the current snowballing meta we have now while also making the Brand support less of a threat early game. 

What are your thoughts?

probably because brand isn't actually op and gold players just need to learn to dodge skillshots.

Nah I have trouble dodging them *in lane* too. Brand isn't just about dodging skillshots, you also have to position out of threat ranges.

A few examples:

- Dodging W but being near minions means he'll cast E on a minion with W and proc E on you which will also apply Spellthiefs.
- Staying away from minions for the above reason but stepping out of minions means possibly getting hit by Q.
- Following both above examples, dodging W by stepping out of minions sets you up to be hit by Q while dodging behind minions lets him step up further for future poke oppurtunities (ADC walks up as well, punishing being near minions while Brand approaches from the side to possibly land an EQ)

There's alot more than this, Brand's spells can actually be used or not even used at all to just act as possible threats forcing movement into more desired positions to land other spells.

He's a pretty unique skillshot mage in this aspect.
Dont act like he is the only mage support that makes you position 100% or you will die. There is many other like this
Difference is other mages generally don't have the damage output to coerce players into such positions. For most of them, the counterplay is just "stay behind minions".

Velkoz, lux, zyra, ziggs, xerath, and many otgers. They all have the capability to blow you up in one combo. Hell, lux only need to hit her Q and R and you are most likely dead, after like 2 E poke. And that Q goes through minions.

Edit: I'll go way in depth here since people wanna dissuade this illogically. Side note: I'm not saying this is a bad thing, I'm saying Brand is a unique skillshot mage in a good way. It's a cool design. It also plays into why he's so good as a support. Anyway:

> Brand
>
> His W is the most threatening poke-wise. Does a good chunk of damage and applies his passive which makes you have to play real careful for the next 4 seconds while it also deals % health damage. This makes opponents careful about dodging it, meaning you can use this factor to set up for EQ or W (E minion to spread to them) Q. Stepping out of the wave isn't a viable option for them, cuz it means possibly eating EQW which does absolutely massive damage.

---

> Velkoz
>
> His Q is avoided by being in the minion wave. This has the same effect as Brand W in coercing enemy movement since it deals respectable damage, but his threatening spell that takes advantage of this coercion is easier to dodge (E). His W carries some of the same effect but since it's a skinny line skillshot, as long as you don't dodge out of the minion wave he isn't gonna set up a Q with it.

---

> Lux
>
> E isn't dodgeable, it's up to her to miss it. That's why the mana cost is high. You just have to dance around to hopefully not eat all her E's by making it harder for her to predict your movement and hope she runs oom soon. Ofc you gotta be wary of passive proc but no lux is gonna walk up to auto after max range E. Her Q is pretty non-threatening as long as you're behind minons. Once there's only 1 left, you back up or just play ballsy and dodge the Q since it's a pretty ok to dodge skillshot. At no point does her E coerce you into getting hit by Q.

---

> Zyra
>
> Dodge E slow line skillshot, try to dodge Q. If you dodge them both you can just kill the plants. If you get hit by Q you gotta back off and wait for plant aggro to go away. At no point does she force you into her E with her Q. She just does generally good poke damage with her Q and plants to force backs.

---

> Ziggs
>
> Dodge bombs. That's about it. Max range satchel won't do much but blow you backwards and his minefield won't affect you if you just stay in or behind minions. At no point are you coerced into moving into a satchel setup.

---

> Xerath
>

There are two ways to spot a person who doesn't understand League game design:

His kit functions right now because he can bully marksmen and tank supports before they scale up.
